summary:
My field of interest is in science-society interaction, dialogue, and trans-disciplinary research in the domain of food systems. My current research focuses on what governance mechanisms, methods and approaches are appropriate for effective dialogues between Universities and societal actors. In the past I have done action research and advisory work on social inclusion and power dynamics in food systems, particularly in low and middle income countries. My PhD research was about the socio-political dimensions of agricultural technology promotion in Ethiopia. 

Expertise areas : participatory action research, multi-stakeholder processes, dialogue, power dynamics and inequality in food systems, agricultural research for development, transdisciplinary research approaches
